result.execSummary:
The defendant Rosemarie NMI Werden was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

miscConds.notes: $25.00 restitution, plus a 10% surcharge of $2.50, plus the 5% restitution surcharge of $24.66 to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.

$265.60 fine/costs to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.

$200.00 DNA surcharge to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.

Must complete any programming required by agent. 

Must provide a DNA sample.  Under Wisconsin Statute 165.76, you are required to provide a biological specimen to the Wisconsin Department of Justice for deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) testing.  If you fail to provide a DNA sample, you may be held in contempt and subject to sanctions or charged with a new crime.
Eligible for expungement upon successful completion of Probation and all restitution/fines/costs are paid within probation term. Must petition court.

timeConds.notes: Must complete 40 hours community service during probation term.
Banked for use by Probation if necessary. Not subject to good time.

11:02 AM Defendant Rosemarie NMI Werden in court.  Attorney Nicholas R White in court for Rosemarie NMI Werden.  Attorney Holly D. Wood Webster in court for State of Wisconsin. RL-clerk. Atty White recites agreement. On count 2- def- G plea. Count 1 RI&D on state's motion. Arguments. Def makes statement. 

SENTENCE: 
W/held sentence 1 year probation. $25.00 restitution, plus 10% surcharge of $2.50 to DA. $265.60 fine/costs. $200 DNA surcharge, DNA sample. Plus 5% restitution surcharge to COCC. 10 days banked jail. Not subj to GT. Must request hearing within 5 days if objecting to any banked jail. Complete any programming required by agent. 40 hours community service. Elig for expungement if def successfully completes probation, has no probation violations and all fines/costs/restitution paid in full within probation term. Must report to probation today. 0 days credit. PCR. 11:19 am adj.
